main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) in the Cleveland, Ohio area in 1955.
interesting points: The objects were described as round, glowing in various colors (red, orange, white, green), and making no sound.
The objects were seen at low altitudes, sometimes hovering or moving slowly, and then accelerating rapidly and disappearing.
Multiple witnesses, including civilians and a member of the UFORC (Unidentified Flying Object Research Council), reported the sightings.
The Air Force investigated the cases and concluded that some were likely misidentifications of aircraft or astronomical phenomena, while others remained unexplained.
The UFORC believed the objects were of extraterrestrial origin and a potential threat to national security, though the Air Force did not come to the same conclusion.
sighted object: Round, glowing objects in various colors
